references.paper_title: Distributed optimization: Analysis and synthesis via circuits
references.reason: This paper introduced the foundational idea of relating distributed optimization algorithms to the dynamics of RLC circuits, which is the basis of this paper's methodology.

references.paper_title: A method of solving a convex programming problem with convergence rate O(1/k2)
references.reason: This is the seminal paper introducing Nesterov's accelerated gradient method, which is a major inspiration and a point of comparison for many of the algorithms discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Performance of first-order methods for smooth convex minimization: A novel approach
references.reason: This paper introduced the Performance Estimation Problem (PEP), which is a key tool used in this paper for automatically verifying the convergence of discretized algorithms.

references.paper_title: Chapter IX applications of the method of multipliers to variational inequalities
references.reason: This paper introduced the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM), a fundamental algorithm in distributed optimization that is analyzed and extended by this paper.

references.paper_title: On the numerical solution of heat conduction problems in two and three space variables
references.reason: This paper introduced the Douglas-Rachford splitting method, a classical algorithm in convex optimization that is analyzed and related to the dynamics of electrical circuits in this paper.
